alert.note: Alert for Carter; Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 8:46AM CDT until May 07 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... James River NEAR Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. Current River near Powder Mill affecting Carter and Shannon Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Current River near Powder Mill. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, County Road 106-531 south of the gage floods near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Friday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.7 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued on or before Saturday morning at 900 AM CDT.
